original_solution_mapping.L1: Let C be the number of posters Cassidy has now.
original_solution_mapping.L2: After this summer, she will have twice as many posters as when she had 14, so she will have C + 6 = 2 * 14 = 28 posters.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Thus, Cassidy has C = 28 - 6 = <<28-6=22>>22 posters now.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7015.
    Returns: the number of posters Cassidy has now.
    """
    # L2
    posters_added_summer = 6 # six more posters
    posters_two_years_ago = 14 # had 14 posters
    double_factor = 2 # double the size
    posters_after_summer = double_factor * posters_two_years_ago

    # L3
    current_posters = posters_after_summer - posters_added_summer

    # FA
    answer = current_posters
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: After this summer, she will have twice as many posters as when she had {posters_two_years_ago}, so she will have C + {posters_added_summer} = {double_factor} * {posters_two_years_ago} = {posters_after_summer} posters.
Thus, Cassidy has C = {posters_after_summer} - {posters_added_summer} = <<{posters_after_summer}-{posters_added_summer}={current_posters}>>{current_posters} posters now.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: After this summer, she will have twice as many posters as when she had 14, so she will have C + 6 = 2 * 14 = 28 posters.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Thus, Cassidy has C = 14 - 6 = <<14-6=8>>8 posters now.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'posters_two_years_ago' (value: 14) was used instead of 'posters_after_summer' (value: 28).
